result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Serve 20 days in Marquette County jail with huber. Consecutive to any sentence he may now be serving. 
Sentence to commence on or before 2/2/16 by 7:00 p.m.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Schultz, Steven J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven J Schultz in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Peebles agrees.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Peebles.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1.
Counsel make sentencing statements.  Defendant makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant sentenced to serve 20 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber, consecutive to any sentence he may now be serving.  Sentence to commence on or before 2/2/16 at 7:00pm, clean and sober.
*Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Payment Plan:  These costs are to be added to defendant's current payment plan.

Defendant Steven J Schultz in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Peebles states that he was going over the paperwork with the defendant and asks for a little more time.  
Atty Hendee does not object.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven J Schultz in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Peebles has just recently received discovery.  Atty Peebles agrees and asks that this be reset 30 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set for plea/sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven J Schultz
Current: P.O. Box 386, 106 W Ormsby St, Apt 3, Oxford, WI 53952   (Effective: 07-14-2015)
Prior: 106 W. Ormsby; Apt 3;pob 386, Oxford, WI 53952

Defendant Steven J Schultz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to get a PD.
Court finds probable cause.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  
Set for Return.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

  Return date scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
